radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver demonstrates normal echogenicity with no focal lesions. The portal vein is patent with normal hepatopetal flow. There is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation. The common bile duct measures approximately 5 mm. The gallbladder is mildly distended with gallbladder wall edema. There are gallstones present and a positive sonographic Murphy sign. There is no pericholecystic fluid. There is a Phrygian cap with possible adherent gallstones or ring-down artifact from adenomyomatosis in the fundus. There is no free fluid within the abdomen. The visualized aorta and IVC are unremarkable.
